results.title: Anti-inflammatory effect of simvastatin in an experimental model of spinal cord trauma: involvement of PPAR-alpha
results.text_hl: In particular, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was less effective in @GENE_PPARA @GENE_19013 @@@PPAR-alpha@@@ KO, compared to WT @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, as evaluated by inhibition of the degree of @<m>DISEASE_Myelitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009187 @@@spinal cord inflammation@@@, neutrophil infiltration, @CHEMICAL_3_nitrotyrosine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C002744 @@@nitrotyrosine@@@ formation, pro-inflammmatory cytokine expression, nuclear factor (NF)-kappaB activation, inducible nitric-oxide synthase (@GENE_NOS2 @GENE_18126 @@@iNOS@@@) expression, and apoptosis.

citations.NLM: Esposito E, Rinaldi B, Mazzon E, Donniacuo M, Impellizzeri D, Paterniti I, Capuano A, Bramanti P, Cuzzocrea S. Anti-inflammatory effect of simvastatin in an experimental model of spinal cord trauma: involvement of PPAR-alpha J Neuroinflammation. 2012 Apr 26;9():81. PMID: 22537532
citations.BibTeX: @article{22537532, title={Anti-inflammatory effect of simvastatin in an experimental model of spinal cord trauma: involvement of PPAR-alpha}, author={Esposito E and Rinaldi B and Mazzon E and Donniacuo M and Impellizzeri D and Paterniti I and Capuano A and Bramanti P and Cuzzocrea S}, journal={J Neuroinflammation}, volume={9}, pages={81}}
